Class Amulet

  • java.lang.Object
    • Card
      • Amulet

  • final class Amulet
extends Card
    This class represent an individual card of type Amulet. An amulet is a card that exists on the field. There are two types of amulets - ones with a countdown and ones without. Amulets with a countdown will have its countdown decreases by one at the beginning of every round, and it will self-destroy when the countdown reaches zero. Amulets without a countdown will stay on field unless it is destroyed or returned by other card's effects. Usually an amulet would have effects that are triggered by other events.

    An amulet instance contains its countdown(if it has one) and the boolean variable isAlive indicating if the card is destroyed or not.

      • Amulet

        Amulet(java.lang.String nme,
       java.lang.String lead,
       int cst,
       java.lang.String rar,
       java.awt.Image handImg,
       java.awt.Image fieldImg,
       int cd,
       java.lang.String effects)
        The constructor runs the Card's constructor first and then initializes the countdown statuses.
        Parameters:
        nme - amulet's name
        lead - amulet's leader
        cst - amulet's cost
        rar - amulet's rarity
        handImg - amulet's hand image
        fieldImg - amulet's field image
        cd - amulet's countdown, 0 if it does not have one
        effects - amulet's effects

    • Method Detail

      • decreaseCountDown

        public void decreaseCountDown(int amount)
        Decreases the countdown by a specific amount. If the countdown turns below or equal to 0 after the decrease, it will self-destroy by setting isAlive to false.
        Parameters:
        amount - the number of countdown to be decreased
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the amulet is not a countdown type

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroys the amulet instantly

      • getCountDown

        public int getCountDown()
        Returns:
        the amulet's remaining countdown, -1 if it is not a countdown type

      • getOrgCountDown

        public int getOrgCountDown()
        Returns:
        the amulet's original countdown, -1 if it is not a countdown type

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Description copied from class: Card
        This method is to be implemented by all kinds of cards to indicate whether the card is alive or not.
        Specified by:
        isAlive in class Card
        Returns:
        true if the amulet is alive, false otherwise

      • isCountDown

        public boolean isCountDown()
        Returns:
        true if the amulet is a countdown type, false otherwise
